definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Asked when Steve Jobs would return, Cook spoke carefully.
sentences.chinese: 当被问到乔布斯何时能重返工作岗位，库克出言谨慎。

sentences.english: How dare such a hairy-faced thing speak rudely to him!
sentences.chinese: 这样满脸胡子的东西，也敢出言无状么？

sentences.english: He that speaketh sophistically, is hateful: he shall be destitute of every thing.
sentences.chinese: 有的人诡辩，出言可恶，他必将缺乏各种食物。

sentences.english: The opprobrium and enmity he incurred were caused by his outspoken brashness .
sentences.chinese: 他招致的轻蔑和敌意是由于他出言过于粗率而造成的。

sentences.english: Today before you think of saying an unkind word, Think of someone who can't speak.
sentences.chinese: 如今，在你出言不逊前，想想那些身患哑疾的人吧。

sentences.english: It was rude of a student to sass to the master.
sentences.chinese: 学生对校长出言不逊是粗鲁无礼的。

sentences.english: Sanshui found YiHeng unexpectedly speak tried to commit suicide, unbearable speak intimidation him.
sentences.chinese: 三水发现乙恒竟说出想自杀后，忍不住出言恫吓他。

sentences.english: There was a barely veiled hostility in her tone.
sentences.chinese: 敌意是由于他出言过于粗率而造成的。

sentences.english: Big sister listen to nine younger sister linesmen, quickly condemned.
sentences.chinese: 大妹听“九妹”出言不逊，急忙谴责。

sentences.english: And New Yorkers pride themselves on quick quip or a biting sarcastic remark.
sentences.chinese: 纽约人也很自豪能够妙语如珠或出言挑衅的讽刺。

sentences.english: I just want to say it, but Ding Yu spoke.
sentences.chinese: 我正想出言挽回时，丁宇却开口了。

sentences.english: You are always abusing and offending people.
sentences.chinese: 你总是出言不逊得罪人。

sentences.english: Don't use time or words carelessly.
sentences.chinese: 不要浪费时间或出言不慎。

sentences.english: U. S. officials were circumspect Tuesday about the actions they're seeking to take against Pyongyang.
sentences.chinese: 美国官员周二对寻求针对朝鲜采取的行动出言谨慎。

sentences.english: She burned with fury at his unkind remarks.
sentences.chinese: 她对他的出言不逊怒火中烧。

sentences.english: Carelessly spoken words can sometimes unsolder ties of friendship.
sentences.chinese: 出言不慎有时会使朋友反目。

definition: to shout at sb to stop
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
